text: Microdramas are a type of short Internet series that started in China. These series are in a vertical format and are designed to be seen on smartphones. They can be watched on media platforms such as TikTok/Douyin (抖音 in China). The Chinese name is duanju (simplified Chinese: 短剧; traditional Chinese: 短劇; pinyin: duǎn jù). There are between 20 and 100 episodes in each series. The episodes are between one and fifteen minutes long. In China, microdramas are popular. The industry is worth billions of dollars. Now they are becoming popular in other countries, such as the United States. https://www.npr.org/2025/02/16/nx-s1-5293094/after-china-micro-dramas-are- gaining-popularity-in-the-us ==References== Category:Internet culture
